it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.client

Class SocketServerConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.common.observer.RemoteObservable<ModelUpdate>
      • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.client.SocketServerConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServerConnection, SocketClientCommandTarget, RemoteObserver<ViewEvent>, Remote

    public class SocketServerConnection
extends RemoteObservable<ModelUpdate>
implements ServerConnection, SocketClientCommandTarget
    Represents a connection to the server implemented by using TCP sockets.

    The socket stream is used in a line-based fashion. The data transmitted via the socket is serialized in JSON format (by Jackson).

    This connection executes in two threads:
    • A thread that listens for incoming commands for the client
    • A thread that executes the command
    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini

      • SocketServerConnection

        public SocketServerConnection(ClientView view)
        Creates a new SocketServerConnection bound to the given view. This means that commands coming from the server will be applied to this view
        Parameters:
        view - the view which uses this connection

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Determines whether the connection is active or not. If the connection was considered to be active, but it results inactive, also closes the socket
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • close

        public void close()
        Attempts to close the connection with the server. If the connection was active, it will be closed, if it was already inactive or closed, nothing will happen. Subsequent calls to isActive() will return false and calls to isClosed() will return true

        It both closes the socket and stops the listener for incoming commands

        Specified by:
        close in interface ServerConnection

      • sendCommand

        public void sendCommand(SocketServerCommand command)
                 throws IOException
        Sends a command to the remote server attached to this target. It also detects if there is a connection problem and closes the socket
        Specified by:
        sendCommand in interface SocketClientCommandTarget
        Parameters:
        command - the command that has to be sent
        Throws:
        IOException - if the command cannot be sent due to network problems
